description: This file defines utility functions for managing and concatenating CSS class names with support for various input types including strings, numbers, arrays, objects, and null/undefined. It includes a helper called toStringValue and an exported function named cn that combines class names logically.

methods.name: function toStringValue(v: ClassValue): string { toStringValue
methods.description: Converts a value of type ClassValue to a string representation, handling strings, numbers, null, undefined, arrays, and objects.

methods.name: export function cn(...values: ClassValue[]): string { cn
methods.description: Concatenates multiple ClassValue inputs into a single string of class names, filtering out falsy values.

ctags.name: ClassValue
ctags.pattern: /^type ClassValue = string | number | null | undefined | Record<string, boolean> | ClassValue[];$/
